visualization_prompt: Generate a 3D column chart showing monthly distribution patterns using synthetic sales data with seasonal variation and statistical validity
visualization_explanation: The dataset represents a univariate time series with 12 monthly observations of consumer electronics sales. Synthetic data was generated using a base normal distribution (μ=130K, σ=55K) with superimposed seasonal components: Q1 ramp-up (+15% monthly), Q2 peak season (+25% growth), Q3 post-holiday decline (-22%), and Q4 stabilization. The 3D column chart was selected to create visual depth while maintaining numerical precision through vertical position encoding. While 3D effects typically conflict with Tufte's data-ink ratio principles, the restrained implementation (depth=50, α/β=15°) preserves direct value comparison through consistent column width and data labels. Cairo's perceptual topology principles are maintained through monochromatic color coding and proportional height encoding. The synthetic dataset exhibits two statistical anchors: annual seasonality (C=1.25) and random variation (ε=±8.2K SD).
